abstract: Commerce Dept reports nation's savings rate fell for third consecutive month in September to 3.6 percent of personal disposable income; decline raises question of whether consumers are returning to their old spendthrift habits, or are temporarily relaxing budgets to make long-awaited purchases.
snippet: With the latest decline in savings, some are asking whether consumers are returning to their old spending habits, while others wonder if the new data is even true.
lead_paragraph: With the latest decline in savings, some are asking whether consumers are returning to their old spending habits, while others wonder if the new data is even true.

headline.main: Savings Rate Is Dropping, and Experts Are Puzzled
headline.print_headline: Savings Rate Is Dropping, And Experts Are Puzzled
headline.seo: Americans’ Savings Rate Drops Again, Puzzling Experts
